job_title: Emergency Room Nurse in Pocatello, ID
pros: The nurses in the department were the best. Cooperation among them was usually very good. Most of the MDs were willing to share their knowledge. For a teaching hospital, it is pretty good.  Ancillary staff is very good and easy to work with.
cons:
could never go to management about a problem without others knowing about it
raises were a joke--$0.06-$1.25.  
Annual reviews were always a time for anger management. Being rated on a scale of 0-4 and receiving a 2.4 is degrading. Management never backed up the nurse, ever. Having been a 4.0 student and then being told that over the year I rated as a 2.4 and that was a good score was ridiculous.

employee morale was at an all time low when I left. Had the manager I had not been the manager, I would have stayed a long time. The day I told him I had to leave, his comment was "do you think you can have your letter of resignation under my door by 5 pm so I can get your job posted." Kind of expected a simple thanks, since he had known for months I had no choice but to leave due to a change in family circumstances.

review_title: Not a friendly or healthy work environment.
pros: Good learning experience and what to look out for in future positions in healthcare.
cons: I do not recommend this place for employment unless you like working long hard hours with minimal help on the floor and go home at the end of the day feeling unappreciated.  Management is dishonest, over worked, stressed, and unapproachable.  This reflects on the entire floor and the visibly stressed manager takes it out on employees.  Team work is nonexistent due to high acuity, no CNAs and a heavy patient workload.  Management talks down to nurses, uses scare tactics, and has openly shared confidential health issues regarding other employees. New grad nurses are being placed in charge nurse positions with little floor experience.  We are given only two weeks notice for mandatory staff meetings and in-services which are often rescheduled at the last minute.   My schedule is also changed often which makes it hard to schedule personal appointments or family time on my days off.  Raises are minimal and not considerate of the hard work and commitment involved.  Reviews are negative with no positive feedback which has caused a general sense of unappreciation overall.  The so-called "competitive" health benefits deny coverage of ALL medical claims, lab work, etc including a general doctor’s visits for basic health conditions.  I have spent hours on the phone on days off with UMR/LHP Benefit Share Plan trying to resolve unpaid claims.  In my personal opinion all of the above is not worth the career risk, stress, or heartache.  This hospital does not seem to care for the well being of the employees.
